class_notes: **Permission of Instructor or BIOS ADAP required**
course_description: Prerequisites: BIOS 508, BIOS 509, BIOS 512, and BIOS 513 or permission of instructor. This course aims to develop basic understanding of the analysis of time-to-event data. The concepts to be introduced include survival functions, hazard rates, right censoring, interval censoring, left truncation, and competing risks. Methods of focus are Kaplan-Meier estimates, log-rank tests, Cox proportional hazards regression models, and parametric regression models. Students will learn how to implement standard survival analysis methods using R and appropriately interpret results.
sections: Class Nbr: 1498, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 10-11:50a, Instructor: N. Dean, Status: Open
